result.execSummary:
The defendant William W Sampone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs of the action. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.
Obtain AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Stayed as long as assessments are done within 60 days and Defendant complies with recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William W Sampone

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant William W Sampone in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Count 1 is amended to battery. Court reviews max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 1, 2. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 1, 2.   State/Defense make sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant William W Sampone in court with attorney Brett E. Reetz.  Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense proposes that Defendant waive prelim on record, then have Court not accept waiver until Defense requests he does. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, holds open waiver which will take effect in 48 hours unless Defense advises otherwise. Waiver will become effective Monday, 4/14.  Defense advises that Defendant will waive time limits for prelim if waiver of prelim is not accepted.  Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  No violent contact direct or indirect with MS.

Defendant William W Sampone in court.  Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Defendant will be getting an attorney.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 10, 2014 at 10:30 am.
